name: Ancient Deep Crow
resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

traits.Magic Resistance: The ancient deep crow has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.
traits.Shadow Stealth: While in dim light or darkness, the ancient deep crow can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

actions.Multiattack: The ancient deep crow makes three attacks: one with its mandibles and two with its claws.
actions.Mandibles: Melee Weapon Attack: +11+1d10 + 6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (2d10 + 6) piercing damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 19+1d10 + 14). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the ancient deep crow can't use its mandibles on another target.
actions.Claw: Melee Weapon Attack: +11+1d10 + 6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d6 + 6) slashing damage.
actions.Shadow Caw: The ancient deep crow releases an ear-splitting caw. Each creature within 60 feet of the crow and able to hear it must make a DC 17+1d10 + 12 Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 10 (3d6) psychic damage.

options.Detect: The deep crow makes a Wisdom (Perception) check.
options.Shadow Caw (Costs 2 Actions): The ancient deep crow uses Shadow Caw.
options.Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions): The ancient deep crow beats its wings. Each creature within 10 feet of the deep crow must succeed on a DC 19+1d10 + 14 Dexterity saving throw or take 13 (2d6 + 6) bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone. The ancient deep crow can then fly up to half its flying speed.
